Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has enough water and light, showing that it is healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant without enough water, illustrating the effects such as wilting or drying up.
The student can draw a plant without enough light, showing how it might look weak or not growing well.
The student can use their drawing to identify that plants need both water and light in order to live and grow.
